comments: I loved this class.  It is not one where you need to be interested in the humanities (I'm interested in science) to appreciate the texts.  There is great diversity in the assigned readings/films.  Both a philosophical and a concrete approach to what makes something beautiful are used.  The course load was perfect for a freshman seminar class (not too light, but not too heavy).
Lots of reading but all interesting.
I loved the freedom of this class. It's a great seminar because it feeds you interesting information in such a wonderful manner,and Professor Scarry is so wise on the subject.
The readings touch upon many subjects ranging from Plato to works of the Middle Ages and present.
